resources.string: NOTE: Before starting any exercise it is recommended that you do at least 5 minutes of warming up, and drink plenty of water before the exercise, during the breaks and after exercise.

Pushups are a great exercise for working out your upper body and arm muscles. Muscles affected;\n\t • Deltoids (Shoulders), Triceps and Biceps which are located on your arms\n\t• Pectorals and Abdominal muscles which are located on your chest and stomach.

Place your device on the floor with the screen facing up. Position yourself in a pushup position, with your head above the phone. Once clicking START do the usual pushup maneuver, but make sure to touch the phone with your chin, or nose as you lower yourself.
Situps focus on increasing the strength of your abdominal muscles. Muscles affected;\n\t • Abdominal muscles located on your stomach.

Get into a situp position and either hold your phone on your chest, or place your hands behind your head while holding the phone in your hands. Before you press START make sure you are already laying on the ground. Once you have started the exercise, you can do your situps, the phone will let you know with a sound that you have completed one situp. The phone will eventually vibrate, indicating that you have completed the round, and you can take a break, or the exercise is over.

Running is a great activity for building leg muscles and increasing your stamina and general fitness. Muscles affected;
	 • Soleus, located on the side of your ankles, also known as inner calf muscles.
	 • Gastrocnemius, located behind the shin bone, also known as calves.
	 • Quadriceps, located on the front on your leg.
	 • Hamstrings, located behind the Quadriceps, on the back of your leg.

NOTE: Make sure you do not look at the phone will running to not hurt yourself. Depending on the difficulty you will be given a set number of rounds with a distance goal for each round. That distance must be reached while you run or job, then you can take a break. Because you are not looking at the phone, you will either holding it while running or putting it in your pocket. The application will therefore alert you if you have reached the distance goal by vibrating and playing a sound.

Squats are solely used to massively increase the power in your legs and hips. Muscles affected;
	 • Quadriceps, located on the front on your leg.
	 • Hamstrings, located behind the Quadriceps, on the back of your leg.
	 • Glutes, located on the back of your hips, the bum cheeks.
	 • Gastrocnemius, located behind the shin bone, also known as calves.

When doing squats, hold your phone in front of you and proceed to do a normal squat by lowering yourself down while keeping your legs in the same position and bending your knees. You can look at your phone while doing squats to see how many squats you have left until a break.

DRINK SOME WATER!
Water is very important when doing exercise, because your body constantly sweats dehydrating your body. It is vital to rehydrate during breaks, and after exercise.

 GET YOUR BREATH BACK!
Your body uses oxygen to fuel your muscles with energy, make sure you take deep breaths during breaks.
